It will be a hands-on workshop to learn about building apps on Bluemix. Participants will get an opportunity to deploy their application and have it running in a matter of hours. This session will cover the following: - Intro by IBM - Fundamentals of Bluemix - Building Mobile app - Chat app and Sales Chart app in no time - Register and hands-on with Bluemix *Bring your own laptop Register here for your Bluemix account.

events.name: Tuesday 9th of June
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along! ---------- FAQs ---------- What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Don't forget! Is this free? Yes! We provide tea, coffee and milo and usually something for dinner. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Like Rails Girls, the Ruby Tea Party is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcome as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! I know nothing about programming, is this for me? Yes! We are happy to teach anyone with any experience, if you are a quick learner that makes it even better.
events.location: TradeGecko Office, 101c Telok Ayer, 068574, Singapore

events.name: An evening on Post Video Productions
events.description: Color Video Grading, a 2-part series by Lynus Hee Movies often use colours to emote a story. To give your videos the cinematic look you don't need fancy machines or softwares to do it. Adobe Certified Instructor Lynus Hee will explain the theory behind colour grading and demonstrate a method that can be used in Adobe Photoshop, Premiere Pro and After Effects. Meet Our Speaker Lynus Hee Apart from a great sense of humour, I have 18 years of experience as a motion graphics designer and photographer. I am also an Adobe Certified Instructor (Video Specialist) and provide training for Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects. Register Here https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-jun-meeting-2015-tickets-17224128833

events.name: June Meetup: Bringing Big Data to Your Organization, Vertical Recommendation
events.description: Here are the topics for the June 10th meetup; additional details to follow. NOTE: This is a different PayPal office from the last meetup! #1 Panel: Brining Big Data into an Organization: War Stories from People on the Front Lines (45 minutes, 15 minute Q&A) • Axel Winter, Global Head of Process & Data Architecture, Standard Chartered Bank • Chris Choy, Assistant VP of SmartHub at StarHub • John Berns, SVP, Head of Data Science at Lazada • Adam Drake, CTO, Skyscanner #2 Paypal: “Vertical Recommendation using Collaborative Filtering” (25 minutes, 5 minute Q&A) #3 Presto in the Cloud Presto is a fast SQL query engine from Facebook. In this talk, I will talk about our experience offering Presto as a Service on Amazon Web Services as part of Qubole Data Services. In our world, Presto clusters are ephemeral - they are instantiated on demand and remain operational as long as necessary and shutdown when not used. We will talk about autoscaling mechanisms that allow the cluster to scale up or down depending on the amount of work in the system - translating to cost savings. We will also talk about caching data in SSDs on new instance types that improves queries over frequently accessed regions of data. We will talk about how query performance improves considerably using the ORC format and present performance numbers to illustrate how Presto can be a great option for fast SQL execution in the cloud. About the speaker Hello there! I'm Siva Narayanan. In my current employment at Qubole, I strive to make Hadoop, Hive and Presto behave well in the cloud. Earlier, I worked on query processing and workload aspects in the Greenplum Parallel Database. I did my undergrad at BITS, Pilani, India and my Ph.D. in Computer Science at The Ohio State University.
events.location: PayPal, Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985, Singapore

events.name: Windows 10 Universal Apps | C# Coding for Absolute Beginners
events.description: Hi All, We will be having a community meetup on Windows 10 Universal Apps Development that can target any Windows 10 devices. This is a full coding (no slides) meetup to develop apps in Windows 10 Universal App using Visual Studio 2015 RC. This will be full C# coding for beginner . And we will also highlight how to use MVVM (Model - View - View Model) and a bit of Win2D (Win2D is an extension of the high performance Graphics API that uses DirectX). We will do some demo coding of graphics/games using Win2D . If you want to follow the coding part, please BYOL (Bring Your Own Laptop). And please have it ready the laptops with Windows 10 Insider Preview installed and Visual Studio 2015 RC installed. If not, you can just come and join the meetup. It will be full of knowledge and very good if you are a beginner in C#. There will be also experts in C#/.NET at the meetup in case you need to ask deep questions on C#/.NET. See you at the meetup.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: HIKVISION CCTV Training (Singapore) -  June 2015 (Back-End Product Road Map/ Turbo TVI)
events.description:
Hikvision Singapore Pte Ltd, has introduced classroom learning to help dealers and installers get up to speed on Hikvision video products. 
Three training modules catered to pre-sales and technical, which are available free to Hikvision customers, let them spend some time in Hikvision Singapore office to learn about the features built into the company’s cameras, DVRs and software. 
  
Agenda for this Training: 
2:30pm - 3:00pm Register/ Tea and Get-Know Session 
3:00pm-3:30pm   Introduction of Back-End Road Map 
3:30-4pm             Tea Break 
4:00pm- 4:30pm   Introduction to Turbo HD Camera and Turbo series DVR- TVI Product Demo iVMS 5200 
 4:30pm - 6:00pm Hikvision Turbo HD Camera and DVR (Hands-On) 
  
  
Hikvision is the world's largest supplier of video surveillance products and solutions. The company specializes in video surveillance technology, as well as designing and manufacturing a full-line of innovative CCTV and video surveillance products. The product line ranges from cameras and DVRs to video management software. Since its inception in 2001, Hikvision has quickly achieved a leading worldwide market position in the security industry. 
Hikvision possess the world's largest R&D team and state-of-art manufacturing facilities; both allow Hikvision’s customers the benefit of world-class products that are designed with cutting-edge technology. As further commitment to its customers, Hikvision annually reinvests 7% of its revenue into R&D for continued product innovation and improvement.
Hikvision operates over 30 domestic branches in China and 16 overseas regional subsidiaries all over the world to achieve a truly global presence. Hikvision is now publicly listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.
Hikvision customers who wish to register their interest in taking advantage of the training modules or to find out more can do so by emailing: ryan.tan@hikvision.com or call 90027441.
events.location: HIKVISION SINGAPORE PTE LTD OFFICE, , 18 Sin Ming Ln,#08-07, MIDVIEW CITY, Singapore 573960

events.name: NUS EML Presents: After Dark Album Launch Party
events.description: Enlisted in 2013 as a National Serviceman of Singapore, pressed by boredom, Mitch Advent Music decided music would be the best escape. After two years of journeying, Electronic Music Producer Mitch Advent is ready to announce the launch of his Album, “After Dark”. Mitch Advent’s self-produced 10-track Album celebrates the end of his time in NS and the start of a new stage in life in his studies at the National University of Singapore (NUS). The Album will be launched on 12th June 2015 (Fri) at NUS Stephen Riady Center, Dance Atelier 2. The NUS Electronic Music Lab will be hosting the event with food & drinks. Mitch Advent warmly invites you to the launch, and would be privileged if you could join him for the evening! Tickets and Album Sales will be at the door: $5.00 - Ticket Only $15.00 - Ticket & After Dark Album $20.00 - Ticket, After Dark Album & Mitch Advent 2014 Originals Compilation $25.00 - Ticket, After Dark Album, 2014 Originals Compilation (MA) & Android, Calling (EML) Mitch Advent https://MitchAdventMusic.bandcamp.com https://youtube.com/MitchAdventMusic https://soundcloud.com/MitchAdvent https://instagram.com/MitchAdvent NUS Electronic Music Lab https://ElectronicMusicLab.bandcamp.com https://youtube.com/ElectronicMusicLab https://soundcloud.com/Electronic-Music-Lab https://instagram.com/Emusiclab

events.name: [Workshop] Introduction to Mobile App Development with Android
events.description: Introduction to Mobile App Development with Android We're back this time with another workshop for you! Limited slots are available so we're only opening this up to 10 ladies. Sunday 14 June 2015 10am - 2.30pm S$50/person - inclusive of packed lunch :) *Please pay on the day itself and let us know if you cannot make it at least 3 days in advance! ----------------------------------------------------------------- Ever wanted to translate your idea into an app but don't know where to start? In this class, we're going to bring you through your first steps in learning about Android App Development. Android is a Linux-based, open source mobile operating system developed by Google. Applications developed on Android are written in the Java programming language, and due to the open nature, anyone can develop Android apps! It currently holds the largest mobile market share, in front of Apple's. This workshop will provide a high level introduction to mobile app development, get participants started on the Android Studio platform (a tool for Android development), and walk participants through the development of their first Android app. By the end of this workshop participants will have created a basic Android application, and be equipped with the knowledge to start building more advanced apps. Tools you'll need to install/ bring along for the workshop: - Android Studio - Java Development Kit (JDK) - Laptop (Windows/Mac/Linux) - Android phone (Optional, we can loan you one if you don't have it but please indicate it to us!) - Phone to PC USB cable Good to have: Previous experience with Java or other object oriented programming language, but not required. Agenda: - Set up things like JDK, Android Studio, etc. - Introduction to mobile development - the rise of mobile and Android - Introduction to Android - little bit of history, delve into some fundamentals such as classes, activities, layouts, controls, events, manifest and more - Get writing some code! Our lead instructor this time is Laura Brandon . Laura is a software engineer from NEC and an avid innovator. Currently Singapore-based, she began her career in New Zealand and is pursuing her dream of working abroad. While she has spent the majority of her career working with facial and fingerprint recognition in global public safety applications, she also has experience researching and developing mobile, wearable, and augmented reality projects. Laura has created several Android applications including a human-to-dog matching app for Fox Network's star dog trainer, Cesar Millan and also augmented reality 'smart glasses' conducting facial recognition. She has run wearable computing workshops in Hong Kong, given talks on biometrics to New Zealand Inland Revenue Department and coached children in mobile application development. Laura is passionate about using emerging technologies to tackle some of the world's toughest challenges, and empowering women through the use of technology.
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore

events.name: The Orange Hive | Life Design; Hacking habits for learning and wellness
events.description: RSVP here! http://www.theorangehive.com/#upcoming-events Only 30 seats. The Orange Hive Community is all about creating curiosity -- learning and being pragmatic, applying design (in the broadest sense) to our businesses and lives. Join us and Debbie from IDEO for a morning of Life Design, followed by lunch with other Orange Hivers! We'll design our own education as lifelong learners, and hack our personal habits for physical and mental wellness, inspired by Debbie's experience in applying design thinking to her own life. You might like to team up with others to get accountability on your goals. Take a look at the curriculum, goals, skills, and highlights (so far) for Debbie's My Life Major! http://www.deborahritapaterson.com/my-life-major **Keep in mind that what we design will be fit uniquely to us, so if you like or dislike part of her design, ask yourself "why" you're feeling that way, rather than committing to her ideas or avoiding something altogether. Life Design | Hacking habits for learning and wellness 14th June, Sunday 10-1pm (followed by lunch mingle) Cover: $10 Venue: The Co-Foundry (11 lor 24A, Geylang) RSVP here! http://www.theorangehive.com/#upcoming-events Only 30 seats.
events.location: The Co-Foundry

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. events.name: Clean & Green Pre-Hackathon Workshop 2015
events.description:
CLEAN & GREEN HACKATHON 2015 
 The Clean & Green Hackathon 2015 (19 to 21 June) is a big step towards cultivating a collective environmental consciousness amongst those of us who call Singapore home. It's an exciting opportunity to apply your expertise and help us become a more active and gracious society, one that respects the environment and takes care of our public spaces.   
The Clean & Green Pre-Hackathon Workshop gives you the chance to gain deeper insights into the hackathon themes and apply them when designing appropriate programmes or applications that address these issues at the hackathon.   

  
Workshop Programme 
Drawing on design thinking principles, the workshop is designed to help you see the problems in new light and from other people's perspectives.    
• Introduction to the hackathon challenges: 1) Reducing Littering and 2) Reducing and Recycling Waste  
• Expert sharing on the topics, including current challenges and future opportunities  
• Hands-on group ideation exercise - share observations, participate in discussion, develop / record insights, ideation and sharing   
Date: Tuesday, 16 June 2015 
Time: 6.30pm - 9.00pm 
Venue: TBC 
  
More Info 
Find out more about the hackathon here. If you've got any questions feel free to get in touch with the hackathon organisers at  hello@upsingapore.com.
events.location: Launchpad@One-North, , Block 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #04-03/04, Singapore 139955

events.name: Null Singapore June Meetup-News Bytes , Fuzzing & Breaking BYOD on iOS
events.description: After successful May meetup , we are again here with our June meetup Agenda: Introduction & Networking : 15 mins News Bytes by Randen : 15 mins Each Talks : 45 Mins • Vulnerability Discovery through Fuzzing by Michael • Breaking BYOD on Apple iOS by Vincent ( Order of the talk might vary ) Directions & Venue Map : 8 Shenton Way AXA Tower, #04-01, Singapore[masked] Abstract of the talk(s) givenbyrespective speakers News Bytes by Randen It will cover the latest news on information security that were in headlines in last month. • Vulnerability Discovery through Fuzzing by Michael Fuzzing can be applied towards binaries and offers many advantages over other approaches to discover security vulnerabilities. This talk will briefly look into a secure development lifecycle before explaining fuzzing and the different techniques that can be applied. The talk concludes with some findings and statistics that have been collected over the time. • Breaking BYOD on Apple iOS by Vincent The global market for BYOD and enterprise mobility is expected to almost quadruple in size over the next four years, hitting $284 billion by 2019. BYOD software is used by some of the largest organizations and governments around the work. Barclays, AT&T, Vodafone, US DHS, US Army, Australian Department of Energy. BYOD software promises security for enterprises. It solves Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Network privacy, jailbreaking devices, but does it really? Nope, it doesn’t! For the past 4 months, I’ve been researching into these advanced functionality that applications are using. The result of my research is an approach to defeating BYOD and advanced iOS security mechanisms in an easy and effective manner. This talk will demonstrate not only how I’ve done it but will also include a tool / framework which was designed for that purpose. Speaker(s) Bio: Michael is a security consultant at SEC Consult. His main interest is towards the offensive realm of information security, particularly vulnerability research and exploit development. Vincent is working as senior security consultant at Vantage Point Security. He is a sharp, cold-blooded, highly focused hacker with a passion for advanced mobile exploitation executed with kiasu perfection. Singaporean by birth, Vincent defies the local stereotype of accepting ‘cannot’ for an answer and lives in a world of only pure possibility. Randen: is a software engineer having 12 years of experience in working on both Enterprise/Proprietary and Open Source Technologies. Currently he is more involve in developing API and mobile applications. He had been interested with security and applies it to how he is developing his applications.
events.location: NSHC PTE Ltd, 8 Shenton Way AXA Tower, #04-01, Singapore 068811
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Working With Data
events.description: This workshop aims to guide participants who will be learning data value chain (including data gathering and cleaning), basic sql, basic R, Python and RapidMiner to enable them to manage and work with data. This two-part workshop will start off with the first 2 hours learning the basic theories of data processing and management. Participant would then be able to implement what they have learnt in the second half of the workshop. Participants are encouraged to have basic programming and statistics knowledge and to bring their own laptops to make the workshop a meaningful experience.
events.location: ITE College Central, , 2 Ang Mo Kio Drive, Singapore 567720

events.name: National Cloud Computing Distinguished Speaker Series - Brian Mathews
events.description:
Capture, Compute, Create: How cloud technology is changing design 
  
Abstract 
The impulse to design is universal, but the tools for changing our world have been limited. Recent cloud technologies are disrupting how professionals design, how non-professionals participate, and how new tools may solve the world’s toughest challenges. This presentation explores the cloud technology trends that are combining to revolutionize the future of making things: Reality Capture, Cloud Data, Infinite Computing, Computational Physics, and 3D Creation. 
  
Biodata 
As Vice President and Platform Group CTO, Brian Mathews helps shape the technology strategy for Autodesk’s platforms and products serving the design, engineering, and construction industries.  He also heads the Reality Computing and Sustainability Solutions business units.  Reality computing involves sensor techniques such as 3D laser scanning, augmented reality, photogrammetry, computer vision, and reverse engineering to model the world.  Previously, he was VP of Autodesk Labs, a hub connecting design professionals with innovative technologies.  He held Software Architecture and Engineering Management positions for collaboration solutions, data publishing, and the graphics technology used in several products including AutoCAD. Prior to Autodesk, he was the Chief Architect at Buzzsaw.com, the leading cloud collaboration tool for the construction industry, and held technical positions at Sun Microsystems and Ithaca Software. Mathews earned his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University. He was the original creator of the DWF format and holds a variety of patents.
events.location: Genexis Theatre, , Fusionopolis, 1 Fusionopolis Way, Fusionopolis (Connexis Tower), Singapore 138632

events.description:
Hikvision Singapore Pte Ltd, has introduced classroom learning to help dealers and installers get up to speed on Hikvision video products. 
Three training modules catered to pre-sales and technical, which are available free to Hikvision customers, let them spend some time in Hikvision Singapore office to learn about the features built into the company’s cameras, DVRs and software. 
  
Agenda for this Training: 
2:30pm - 3:00pm Register/ Tea and Get-Know Session 
3:00pm-3:30pm   Introduction of Back-End Road Map 
3:30-4pm             Tea Break 
4:00pm- 4:30pm   Introduction to Turbo HD Camera and Turbo series DVR- TVI Product Demo iVMS 5200 
 4:30pm - 6:00pm Hikvision Turbo HD Camera and DVR (Hands-On) 
  
  
Hikvision is the world's largest supplier of video surveillance products and solutions. The company specializes in video surveillance technology, as well as designing and manufacturing a full-line of innovative CCTV and video surveillance products. The product line ranges from cameras and DVRs to video management software. Since its inception in 2001, Hikvision has quickly achieved a leading worldwide market position in the security industry. 
Hikvision possess the world's largest R&D team and state-of-art manufacturing facilities; both allow Hikvision’s customers the benefit of world-class products that are designed with cutting-edge technology. As further commitment to its customers, Hikvision annually reinvests 7% of its revenue into R&D for continued product innovation and improvement.
Hikvision operates over 30 domestic branches in China and 16 overseas regional subsidiaries all over the world to achieve a truly global presence. Hikvision is now publicly listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.
Hikvision customers who wish to register their interest in taking advantage of the training modules or to find out more can do so by emailing: ryan.tan@hikvision.com or call 90027441.

events.name: ISS Seminar - Online Collaboration: Fact or Fiction?
events.description:
Online Collaboration is the child of Knowledge Management and the Internet, a new paradigm of professional cooperation in organisations made possible by the social capabilities of the web. It is also the open secret to solving the productivity problems entrenched in many companies stuck in the world of emails and silos. Implementing and adopting online collaboration is, however, easier said than done.  
In this seminar, you will hear: 

State of online collaboration in Singapore
Overview of selected online collaboration tools
The importance of culture and adoption

 Who Should Attend Social Media Folks: professionals in the business of dealing with social, digital, marketing, branding, content, development and strategy, especially internal social. If you’re keen to find out what’s going to be relevant and beneficial to your business and life in the fast-paced world of social, this seminar is for you.  
For detailed agenda, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/Events/ISSSeminars/OnlineCollaborationFactorFiction.aspx 
  
  
Please note that this site is not developed nor maintained by the Institute of Systems Science at the National University of Singapore (NUS-ISS).  This is a third party independent site subject to its own data protection and privacy practices and you are encouraged to examine them before proceeding to share your personal data.  NUS-ISS will collect, use and/or disclose the personal data submitted through this third party independent site for the purpose of administration and/or management of the event.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.name: Cyber Espionage Activities on IOT Devices
events.description:
With the encouraging response from our previous seminar, KICC & NSHC has decided to continue sharing top classified information on Cyber Espionage Activities on IOT devices. The main objective of this seminar is to create awareness and educate the public on the critical threat in the current environment. There will also be exciting live demonstration on CCTV and VOIP hacking. 
  
Topic 
               Introduction about NSHC 
               How Safe is Your IOT devices 
  
-          Discovery of Cyber Espionage Status on Different Countries  
  
-          Cyber Spying Activities on IOT devices 
  
-          Cyber Espionage Activities on CCTV/IP Camera 
  
Live Demonstration 
  
-          Technical Live Demo on CCTV/IP Camera Spying 
  
-          Technical Live Demo on VOIP(Skype) Hacking 
Conclusion 
Q&A

events.name: BayesiaLab Workshop: Artificial Intelligence for Research, Analytics, and Reasoning
events.description:
In fields ranging from bioinformatics to marketing science, Bayesian networks have revolutionized the way scientists explore high-dimensional problem domains. And, since the first release of the BayesiaLab software package in 2001, practitioners have been able to leverage this powerful paradigm for their research without having to write a single line of code. 
Learn what the Bayesian networks revolution is all about, and join Stefan Conrady and Dr. Lionel Jouffe for a complimentary workshop on knowledge discovery with Bayesian networks and BayesiaLab. In the presentation, we will first lay out the basics of the Bayesian network formalism and then illustrate a practical application in a live software demo. 
Target Audience: 
Applied researchers, statisticians, data scientists, data miners, biologists, biostatisticians, epidemiologists, predictive modelers, econometricians, economists, engineers, market researchers, knowledge managers, marketing scientists, social scientists, students and teachers in related fields.
events.location: Matrix @ Biopolis, , 30 Biopolis St, Level 4, Singapore 138671

events.name: Latest IP issues in 3D printing & a Cool 3D Print on the Flashforge Dreamer
events.description: Did you ever wonder about the IP issues when you download a free 3D model and print it on your home 3D printer? Or when you developed a software to render a popular figurine as a 3D model on your web page? IP implications are still evolving in an industry as nascent as 3D printing, but it is looming in the horizon. Find out how you can navigate the 3D printing landscape safely for hobby or for business.....and what's a hacker meetup without cool hacks! Yes, we will try 3D scanning a pair of glasses and replicating it by 3D printing :))
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: Center for Environmental Sensing and Modeling Workshop 2015
events.description:
CENSAM Annual Workshop 2014 
















CENSAM Annual Workshop 2014







View this email in your browser











 









 


ANNUAL WORKSHOP 2014







 








  
25 JUNE 2014    ERC AUDITORIUM  NUS UTOWN,  CREATE  



GET DIRECTIONS














  
CENSAM 7th Annual Workshop  







Invitation from Organisers    The Center for Environmental Sensing and Modeling (CENSAM) is pleased to invite you to its 7th Annual Workshop. In designing this year's programme, we have aimed at balancing scientific interest, diversity and accessibility for a broad audience. A number of CENSAM researchers and collaborators will present short talks, providing a flavour of the diverse interdisciplinary research being conducted at CENSAM. 
We are pleased to announce that Mr Choi Shing Kwok (Permanent Secretary, Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources) and Prof Peter J. Edwards (Director, Singapore-ETH Centre, SEC) will present keynote talks and will be available for Q&A. In addition, we have set aside significant time for poster sessions, providing space for interaction over refreshments. 
We look forward to welcoming you at CENSAM's 7th Annual Workshop. Please click the register button below and do not hesitate to contact us if you require further information/assistance.    (Feel free to forward this invitation to colleagues who might be interested in attending our workshop) 








 







REGISTER HERE











 








CONTACT ORGANISERS 













 

 

 


  



  


 




 







AGENDA

Selected posters overview - various speakers

Asian buffet lunch and poster session

Climate variability and the geomorphology of tropical peatlands - Alex Cobb (CENSAM)

events.name: 2-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101
events.description:
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore 
"Currently, Bayesian Networks have become one of the most complete, self-sustained and coherent formalisms used for knowledge acquisition, representation and application through computer systems." (Bouhamed et al., 2015) 
Join this course to learn about the principles of Bayesian networks and how to apply them for research and analytics with the BayesiaLab software platform. You will see that Bayesian networks are ideally suited to model a wide range of high-dimensional problem domains. Overall, this course's focus in on leveraging Bayesian networks for applied research, with the objective of solving problems that currently appear difficult or intractable with traditional statistical methods. 
This "short course" is a compact version of the highly acclaimed 3-Day Introductory BayesiaLab Course, which we have been offering around the world for almost ten years. We have designed this new 2-day course for scientists who are interested in utilizing Bayesian networks for their research, but for whom the current 3-day program might be too much of a time commitment. 
Throughout this course, we exclusively use the BayesiaLab software platform. Therefore, you have access to a full license of BayesiaLab Professional for a 30-day period starting on the first day of the course. This gives you the opportunity to replicate all examples from the course at your leisure on your own computer. 
 
Date and Location 
July 2-3, 2015 9:00am-5:00pm (both days) 
Singapore Management University School of Accountancy 60 Stamford Road Seminar Room 2.5 Singapore 178899 
Overview 
Day 1 

Introductory Examples of Probabilistic Reasoning:
Prosecutor's Fallacy
Simpson's Paradox
Bayes' Rule and the Bayesian Network Formalism
Graph Structures, d-Separation
Encoding Bayesian Networks from Domain Knowledge
Omnidirectional Inference for Diagnosis and Simulation
Observation versus Intervention/Causation

Day 2 

Prerequisites for Machine-Learning Bayesian Networks:
Information Theory, incl. Entropy, Mutual Information, Minimum Description Length
Unsupervised Structural Learning for Knowledge Discovery
Supervised Learning for Predictive Modeling, Feature Selection
Variable Clustering
Data Clustering
Latent Factor Inductions and Probabilistic Structural Equation Models
Network Analysis and Simulation
Using Bayesian Networks for Decision Support

What's required?  

Working knowledge of specifying and estimating linear models.
No prior knowledge of Bayesian networks or Bayesian statistics is required.
No programming skills are required. You will use the graphical user interface of BayesiaLab for all exercises in class.

Who should attend?  
Bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, clinical scientists, computer scientists, data scientists, decision scientists, demographers, ecologists, econometricians, economists, epidemiologists, knowledge managers, management scientists, market researchers, marketing scientists, operations research analysts, policy analysts, predictive modelers, research investigators, risk managers, social scientists, statisticians, plus students and teachers of related fields. 
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Accountancy, , 60 Stamford Road, Seminar Room 2.5, Singapore 178899

events.name: Singapore Microbiome Networking Symposium
events.description:
Singapore Microbiome Networking Symposium  
NUS Centre for Life Sciences, Auditorium 
Monday, 28th July 2015 
Time: 09:00-16:00  

  
Sponsored by Department of Biochemistry (National University of Singapore, NUS) and American Society of Microbiology (ASM), Singapore Micriobiome Networking Symposium aims to promote scientific exchanges and collaborations in the field of Microbiome Research. 
This year, with the support of Singapore Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (SSBMB), Singapore Society for Microbiology and Biotechnology (SSMB), Department of Microbiology (NUS), and NUS Synthetic Biology for Clinical and Technological Innovation (SynCTI), the symposium will be held in NUS Centre for Life Sciences Auditorium. Invited speakers will be sharing developments and new insights on the human microbiome. 
We warmly invite graduate students, postdoctoral fellows, fellow biologists and researchers to attend this special event. Come join us and find out the latest developments in microbiome research! 
  
PS: Please select the ticket type "Expression of Interest Talk" to indicate that you wish to present in this networking symposium (Duration: 5 min).  
  
Organising committee: 
A/P Gan Yunn Hwen (Chair) 
A/P Yew Wen Shan 
A/P Thilo Hagen 
A/P Lee Yuan Kun 
Dr Ratha Mahendran 
  
 FAQs  
1. Where is the event held? 
The event will be held at the Auditorium located at the first floor of CeLS. 
The full address is as follows: 
  
National University of Singapore 
Centre for Life Sciences 
28 Medical Drive 
Singapore 117456 
  
  
2. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Arriving by public transport (Bus) 

Take bus service 95 at bus-stop along MOE building.
Service 95 will turn into the National University Hospital (NUH).
Alight at the 1st bus stop.
You should see a gentle slope up towards Medical Drive. Walk up Medical Drive until you reach the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building on your right.     

Arriving by public transport (MRT) 

If you’re not on Circle Line, take the MRT to Buona Vista.
Make that switch to Circle Line to Kent Ridge Station.
Alight at Kent Ridge Station.
Walk towards Kopitiam Foodcourt towards the other end of National University Hospital (NUH) main building. You should then see a gentle slope up towards Medical Drive. Walk up Medical Drive until you reach the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building on your right.    

Arriving by private transport/taxi 

Take a taxi or private vehicle to the Ayer Rajah Expressway (AYE).
Turn off at the South Buona Vista/NUH (National University Hospital) exit.
Head towards NUH (don’t turn into NUH) and go straight until you see Medical Drive. Turn left into Medical Drive and stop outside the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building.
Private vehicles can park in the public carparks located in NUH Medical Centre or at the open air carpark atFaculty of Science, opposite Faculty of Dentistry.    

Science Carpark 
Operating Hours: 0830 to 1930 
Parking Rates: $0.0214 per minute (maximum charge of $1.284 for vehicles entering from 6pm to 7.30pm on weekdays) 
NUH Medical Centre 
Operating Hours: 0000 to 2359 
Parking Rates: $0.035 per minute
events.location: Centre for Life Sciences, , 28 Medical Drive, National University of Singapore, Singapore 117456

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!
